Hold your own keys...*We recommend to use tronlink pro wallet*                               https://t.me/dailytronwinner

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Yooo what the heck is going on here?You mean all o have to do is to transfer my money to a wallet address that’s been posted in a telegram channel that was created yesterday and wait for me to win. I do have a few questions for you. How do you select winner?why don’t you have a site?You don’t have any players, judging from the number of telegram subscribers you have. How are you going to generate the money to pay winners?From what we know, the telegram channel is just a day old and your account here is a newbies rank which means that you can decide to run away with players funds with out any traces, so how do you prove to those that might want to check it out that their funds are safe?I’d advise that y’all should stay away from this game unless the Op talks more on how the game works and answers few questions that have been answered.

This raises questions about the legitimacy and long-term sustainability of the project.The return sounds too good to be true and might be a deceptive tactic to lure participants. Also, the lack of transparency and the potential for scams raise significant red flags. It's crucial to exercise caution and conduct thorough research before investing any funds.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: This is a pure scam, and I do not advice anybody here to participate in this, they will just swallow your money over and over and over again while you keep thinking you are probably not just lucky yet.This is a scam strategy, and in this game, there will never be any winners, except the owner, or organizer of this scam. This is how it will work, first, understand that there is no transparency here, there is no way to know who won exactly they could send coins to one of their random wallets and claim the owner of that wallet won, meanwhile the participants in the game won't have any means of knowing who that wallet belongs to in other to confirm if he or she really won or not.Imagine 100 persons send 1000 trx each, they send back 300 trx to each of those 100 persons for them to appear legit, then send the remaining trx to one of their wallet, and claim the owner of that wallet won the jackpot, meanwhile, that wallet belongs to them, and then, they move on to another round, they keep repeating this over and over again scamming unsuspecting Victims their trx.This is a scam guys. Please avoid.
